class_notes: In this course, we critically analyze Muscogee (Creek) literary written and oral traditions by examining Creek history in relation to Creek literature. Students will read and discuss short stories, poetry, letters, essays, and novels by Muscogee Creek authors in relation to both their pre-removal history in Georgia and Alabama and their post-removal history in Indian Territory, the present-day state of Oklahoma. Among other authors, we will read Joy Harjo, Craig Womack, Alexander Posey and Laura Harjo.
course_description: Study of Indigenous literatures, with a focus on a specific topic. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
schedule_location: TTh 1pm-2:15pm in Math & Science Center - W307C
